author: Matt Couden
title: DWTS fans react as Julianne Hough makes ‘fresh start’ change to her appearance
text: Julianne Hough decided to make a significant change for the new year, as she changed up her look. The Dancing With the Stars co-host recently revealed how she altered her appearance in 2024 for a “fresh start.” Hough uploaded a video clip of herself performing a self-trim as she chopped off some of her locks for a new hairstyle. As the video begins, Hough is seated in a chair. Someone off-camera handed her some shears, and she started to cut her hair at an angle to make it shorter. “Oh, that’s so fun. Like this length. 2024 y’all. This is the new way, guys; you just cut your own hair,” Hough said. “And that, my dears, is a seven-minute haircut,” she said as she revealed her revised hairstyle, adding, “It’s so cute!” Hough reflects on the ‘seasons of life’ with her ‘fresh start’ change Hough also shared a reflective message about how the weather got her thinking about “the seasons of life” and “decisions we make” as we progress on our journeys. “Hair is such an outward expression of what those decisions are…of the internal journeys that we go through. The idea of the rain pouring, which could’ve been a melancholy day, but the sun was shining so bright that it almost felt like a cleansing. (I know, I know, but seriously!),” Hough captioned her video post. She also mentioned a rainbow that appeared, indicating it’s a “sign of prosperity and all the life that is to come.” “It just felt like it was the right time to cut off some of the old energy and start fresh,” Hough shared. Fans react to Hough’s change to her hair With the DWTS star changing her hair, many fans and critics reacted to her new look. As of this writing, there were over 47,000 likes and 400-plus comments on the IG post. “Why are you doing it yourself?” one individual asked. “Now everyone is going to think they can cut their own hair and look like you,” another commented, with a crying laughing emoji. “no no don’t cut your gorgeous hair,” a commenter said, seeming against Hough’s haircut. Yet another asked the cost for Hough’s “self-checkout haircut.” Many fans also seemed to favor Hough’s decision to change things up and applauded her for the bold move to cut her hair. Hough said ‘big things’ are on the way Hough’s remarks indicate she is looking toward a “fresh start” in 2024. Another Instagram post she shared last week showed her in a stylish black and white pinstripe outfit posing at a fancy hotel’s “Lover Suites Lobby.” “Business mode⚡️Big things are coming in 2024… stay tuned,” she teased in her caption. The DWTS judge faced criticism during the recent season of the popular dance competition for several fashion decisions, including her [outfit for the DWTS finale](https://www.monstersandcritics.com/tv/reality-tv/dwts-star-julianne-hough-blasted-for-hideous-and-inappropriate-outfit-during-season-32-finale/). However, many fans welcomed her as one of the show’s judges and seemed to enjoy the former dance professional in that role on the show. Hough is expected to return for the show in 2024 alongside host [Alfonso Ribeiro](https://www.monstersandcritics.com/tv/reality-tv/alfonso-ribeiro-joins-dancing-with-the-stars-as-co-host-alongside-tyra-banks/). Dancing With the Stars Season 33 premiere is TBA for ABC and Disney+.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: 'Queen of Doty Island' celebrated by special friends on 100th birthday
text:
By Ezekiel Telemaco ,
4 hours ago The Queen of Doty Island, as many lovingly know her, celebrated her 100th birthday on Wednesday. And a group of special friends reminded her how much she means to them.
Video shows a group of school children singing happy birthday to Arline Dabill, who turned 100 years old on Wednesday. Arline moved across from now-closed Roosevelt Elementary in 1960, becoming a friend to generations of children. Arline's advice for living a long life is to take it one day at a time. (The following is a transcription of the full broadcast story)
"There's no amount of money that can buy what they did for me today," said Arline Dabill.
Outside her home, dozens of school children sang happy birthday for Arline, who just turned 100 years old.
"I need a hug, I need a hug," she said.
Arline got to know these kids, and generations of students before them, when she bought a house across the street from now-closed Roosevelt Elementary School in 1960.
"They've never let me down. I lost my husband six years ago, and they're here for me," said Arline.
Sometimes, she'd play with the kid when they got out of school. And after retiring at 70, she took a job as a playground attendant at Roosevelt.
Now, 100 years old, the kids still find her on her porch, where she reflects on her long life.
"Sometimes I feel guilty because I lost two of my older sisters and the three and four youngest ones. They're all gone and I'm here," said Arline.
At her age, looking back on a long life, Arline says she feels everything around her.
"It doesn't take much for me to be happy. It doesn't take much to make me cry," she said.
And though she's lost many in this long life, the Queen of Doty Island, as many know her, is still gaining others.
"Whenever I was not feeling top of the world, all I had to do was come on the porch in nice weather and watch the children," Arline said.
Arline advice to living a long life is just to take it one day at a time.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: VNExplorer
title: Sophie Codegoni al parco con Celine e Basciano: "Ci stiamo riavvicinando"
text:
Sophie Codegoni al parco con Celine e Basciano: “Ci stiamo riavvicinando”
L’ex gieffina Sophie Codegoni e Alessandro Basciano sono stati paparazzati insieme alla figlia Celine Blue al luna park. Le foto li ritraggono in un quadretto che sembra raffigurare il nuovo equilibrio che i due ex hanno raggiunto dopo la crisi affrontata nei mesi scorsi. Secondo delle indiscrezioni i due si stanno riavvicinando moltissimo.
Sophie Codegoni, il riavvicinamento con Alessandro Basciano: le foto insieme Tra Sophie Codegoni e Alessandro Basciano sembra essere tornato il sereno. Dopo la rottura molto turbolenta e pubblica e le dichiarazioni rilasciate a Verissimo i due ex concorrenti del Grande Fratello Vip hanno ritrovato un equilibrio per il bene della figlia Celine Blue. Il settimanale Chi li ha immortalati al luna park insieme in compagnia della loro bambina. Con l’ex coppia c’era anche la madre dell’influencer, Valeria Pasciuti.
L’ex gieffina e il padre di sua figlia Alessandro Basciano hanno trascorso una giornata a luna park a Milano. Secondo il settimanale di Alfonso Signorini si stanno riavvicinando notevolmente. Nelle foto scattate dai paparazzi i due passeggiano spingendo il passeggino di Celine Blue, poi tentano di vincere un peluche per la piccola e provano un gioco insieme, scoppiando a ridere. Con loro è presente anche la madre di Sophie con cui il deejay aveva un rapporto conflittuale.
I due ex concorrenti del Grande Fratello Vip annunciavano la fine della loro relazione soltanto lo scorso ottobre. In un’intervista rilasciata a Verissimo l’influencer aveva fatto un ritratto poco lusinghiero del suo compagno. Sophie aveva svelato di aver scoperto di essere stata tradita dal padre di sua figlia con la sua ex. Inoltre l’aveva accusato di essere andato a dormire quando lei stava partorendo. Poi aveva lanciato la bomba: era stata anche picchiata. Quando è stata la volta di Alessandro Basciano di sedersi nello studio di Silvia Toffanin, il deejay aveva smentito tutto.
Agli inizi di marzo, poi, sono spuntati fuori i primi segnali del disgelo tra i due. I due sono stati immortalati abbracciati al concerto di Mr. Rain ed è arrivata anche una dichiarazione della Codegoni in merito alla fine della rabbia tra loro. Le foto pubblicate da Chi sembrano confermare come i due genitori abbiano trovato un equilibrio.
Siamo due genitori, la cosa che ci interessa di più in assoluto è avere una situazione serena. Ci siamo amati tantissimo e quando passa la rabbia iniziale, torna la maturità e la voglia di stare insieme, soprattutto per il bene di Celine

author: Purepeople
title: "On m'a transfusée" : Camille Lellouche raconte tout de la naissance compliquée de sa fille Alma - Purepeople
text: [Camille Lellouche](/people/camille-lellouche_p538000) a eu des difficultés à tomber enceinte. Mais elle a finalement donné naissance [à son premier enfant, en octobre 2022](/article/camille-lellouche-maman-pour-la-premiere-fois-sa-fille-est-nee-elle-devoile-son-doux-prenom_a495612/1). Et elle n'a décidément pas eu de chances puisque son accouchement n'a pas été de tout repos non plus. "Ça a duré 24h, j'ai eu une hémorragie à la fin. On m'a transfusée (...) J'ai senti en fait tout l'accouchement pendant 3h" a-t-elle raconté, cette semaine sur le plateau de La Maison des Maternelles sur France 2, alors qu'elle a pourtant reçu "deux péridurales". La première n'a pas fait effet parce qu'elle avait malheureusement été mal effectuée. Ce témoignage est toute transparence, l'artiste de 37 ans l'a apporté alors qu'elle est en pleine promotion de son livre Tout te dire publié le 6 mars dernier aux éditions Stock. La période post-accouchement a également été agitée : "Petite, j'étais vraiment en admiration devant ces séries où elles prennent le bébé, elles ont un petit peu de transpiration, elles sont toutes belles avec le brushing bien fait, et moi j'avais un bouton de fièvre, 20kg en plus." Mais Camille Lellouche assume le fait que s'occuper d'un bébé, ce n'est pas tout rose. C'est ce qu'elle a tenu à dire il y a quelques jours sur le plateau de C à Vous, sur France 5, où elle a également évoqué les conséquences de son accouchement sur sa vie professionnelle : "On fait des métiers où d'un coup ça marche très fort et tu gagnes bien ta vie, puis d'un coup un peu moins, et dans la période 'un peu moins", moi j'ai eu mon enfant. Quand j'étais enceinte, j'ai tout arrêté, c'était une priorité absolue pour moi." Un passage lors duquel elle a aussi, outre [ les violences conjugales](/article/-je-suis-devenue-une-ombre-camille-lellouche-en-larmes-s-exprime-sur-les-violences-qu-elle-a-subie_a465436/1) qu'elle a subies plus jeune, délivré une anecdote au sujet du prénom de sa fille. En effet, cette dernière se prénomme Alma. Mais elle était censée porter le nom de Noa. Sauf que c'était déjà le prénom que la célèbre chanteuse [Vitaa](/people/vitaa_p753) avait donné à sa fille, quelques mois plus tôt. Camille Lellouche s'est donc ravisée : "Je me suis dit, comme on est toutes les deux très exposées, je me suis dit, quand même, c'est bizarre de...Et en plus [ j'avais déjà fait graver des choses](/article/video-j-avais-deja-fait-graver-des-choses-camille-lellouche-a-change-le-prenom-de-sa-fille-a-cause-d-une-star_a520535/1) et je me suis dit 'oh non, je vais devoir tout changer...'"

author: LMNeuquen
title: Mucho malestar en la Justicia neuquina, con dotaciones mínimas y servicios desiertos
text:
Trabajadores judiciales anunciaron medidas de fuerza en todas las oficinas de la provincia ante la urgente necesidad de incorporar personal administrativo en varias dependencias que están con dotaciones mínimas y, en otras, donde directamente no hay nadie que pueda responder a las demandas de la población. Puntualmente, en áreas que son muy sensibles como las oficinas de violencia, juzgados de familia y defensorías civiles y de los derechos de los niños y adolescentes.
"La situación es crítica, no da para más. Tenemos una necesidad concreta de nuevos ingresos a varias dependencias de la provincia. En algunos lugares, no hay atención de profesionales y personal administrativo", aseveró el secretario general del gremio Sejun, Claudio Salazar.
En diálogo con LMNeuquén , aseguró que "instamos a las autoridades a reclamar el presupuesto necesario para que el poder judicial pueda funcionar . De lo contrario, si no se atiende la demanda, estamos ante una verdadera denegación de Justicia; y los primeros responsables serán los vocales del Tribunal Superior y los funcionarios inferiores".
Tribunal sejun Bocinazo de Sejun frente al Tribunal Superior de justicia.
El problema lo plantearon en la mesa técnica que se abrió luego del acuerdo salarial para zanjar la urgente necesidad de incorporar personal administrativo y profesionales. Salazar consideró que los vocales del Tribunal tienen que "tomar cartas en el asunto" y definir una política judicial. Al final, añadió, "siempre atendemos situaciones de emergencia y no se ataca el problema de fondo, vinculado a los problemas de infraestructura y de falta de recurso humano".
Un dato: Salazar señaló que el 80 por ciento de los servicios funcionan en inmuebles adaptados con poca o nula accesibilidad.
Si bien reconoció que " el congelamiento de la planta por este año es una exigencia del Ejecutivo ", advirtió que más allá de la coyuntura que se vive, las necesidades de personal administrativo y profesionales "son grandes". Sobre todo, en áreas que receptan la población más vulnerable. "El Tribunal tiene que tener la decisión política y tomar una posición que defienda el poder judicial. Si no estamos ante una denegación de justicia ", reiteró.
Denuncian sobrecarga En un duro comunicado que el gremio dirige hacia la presidencia, ejercida por la doctora María Soledad Gennari, se indicó que la falta de personal tiene otros efectos colaterales, como la sobrecarga del "escaso personal existente y que en muchos casos se traduce en consecuencias en la salud psico física de los y las trabajadores/as".
En esa comunicación, Salazar adelantó que este viernes se realizarán asambleas en toda la provincia. En tanto, el día 30 el sindicato adhirió a la Jornada Nacional de lucha impulsada por la Federación Judicial Argentina, disponiéndose un retiro únicamente desde las oficinas de Neuquén a las 10 horas.
Embed Ver esta publicación en Instagram Una publicación compartida de SEJuN (@sejun.oficial)
Paralelamente, desde el sindicato se trabaja en la elaboración de un listado para llegar al número concreto de ingresos que necesitan cubrir. De forma inicial, Salazar indicó que se requieren unos 80, este año, en toda la provincia. Los postulantes están porque ya pasaron por un concurso público muy riguroso, que duró un año y fue de público conocimiento.
"El orden de mérito todavía no se activa. Nosotros atendimos a varios aspirantes. No tenemos capacidad de representarlos, pero solidariamente también pedimos por su ingreso. Tienen todo el derecho de poder ingresar a trabajar, y más si se necesita personal ", concluyó.
Neuquén: ¿Por qué siguen congelados los ingresos por concurso a la Justicia?
Se demora el juicio de Otoño Uriarte: se fugó uno de los acusados y creen que está en Neuquén

author: Ann Brown
title: Jonathan Herman: Bridging Technology And Social Empowerment
text: [by Ann Brown](https://www.blackenterprise.com/author/ann/) January 7, 2024 How One Entrepreneur Is Bridging Technology Innovation And Social Empowerment Jonathan Herman is the driving force behind Strong Interactive, a parent company of groundbreaking Web3 ventures. Jonathan M. Herman, the driving force behind Strong Interactive, a parent company of groundbreaking Web3 ventures, looks to bridge innovation and social empowerment. With a multifaceted career spanning technology innovation and community development, Herman strives to have an impact beyond the boardrooms and computer screens. According to its website, Strong Interactive is “trailblazing the future of Web3 and the Internet…through innovative approaches that provide frictionless user experiences with immediate utility and value” that “leverage the power of mobile devices that most consumers already possess — creating immediate value for B2C and B2B initiatives across multiple sectors.” One of Herman’s flagship ventures, Baller Mixed Reality aims to push technological boundaries. This venture specializes in creating autographed metaverse collectibles featuring athletes and entertainers. Baller [earned the title ](https://www.accesswire.com/728068/Jonathan-Herman-Joins-Crunchbases-List-of-Top-10-Founders-Worldwide)of the “Most Pioneering Memorabilia NFT Company” of 2022 from Wealth & Finance Magazine. In addition to Baller Mixed Reality, Herman’s entrepreneurial journey includes the establishment of Bocazon.com, which has an initial “soft launch” in 2016. Bocazon.com, according to its website, is the first company in Panama to offer online shopping across a wide variety of categories and major brands for the home, outdoors, road and water sports. Herman is also dedicated to social empowerment and community development. As such, he serves on the National Board of Directors for the Association for Enterprise Opportunity, one of the nation’s largest economic development organizations. Here, he actively contributed to initiatives aimed at fostering economic growth and creating opportunities for individuals from all walks of life. Herman says he believes in the intersection between technology and social empowerment. “I find the current state of Web3 development to be one of the most inclusive business sectors that I’ve experienced, where quality business concepts are met with opportunities for collaboration across the spectrum of talented contributors,” Herman [said at the “Bored Ape, Metaverse, and NFT” panel](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/jonathan-herman-ranked-among-top-174000622.html) discussion at Van Jones’ Black Future Weekend in 2022. “The decentralized nature of blockchain technology itself is a cooperative system that lends itself to an ethos of meritocracy and inclusion. Therefore, I believe that entrepreneurs from traditionally disadvantaged communities can find clear entry points, which benefits the entire tech sector by including the brightest minds from all quarters.” RELATED CONTENT: [How the Black Metaverse is Changing the Digital Game](https://www.blackenterprise.com/how-the-black-metaverse-is-changing-the-digital-game/)

author: Angelica James
title: A Williamsburg café fights food insecurity and inequity in the coffee industry - ABC7 New York
text: WILLIAMSBURG, NEW YORK -- Bushwick Grind in Williamsburg is a café that tackles social issues. In 2015, Kymme Williams-Davis and her husband Raymond Davis saw a need to create a business that offered a welcoming environment. Their café fosters community with alternatives to the fast-food options in the surrounding area. Two years prior to the Bushwick Grind's opening, Williams-Davis learned of the lack of equity in the coffee field. According to Fairtrade International, farmers received low compensation for their coffee beans, producers, on average, retaining one percent of the retail coffee price, prompting an increase in the fairtrade minimum price for coffee. A coffee producer would make around $0.04 USD per each $4 USD cup of coffee. According to the National Coffee Association USA, women contribute 40-80% of the labor in the coffee industry. Williams-Davis has pledged to work with roasters and distributors that are actively working to invest in the communities from which they source their coffee. She currently imports house espresso from Yirga Chefe, Ethiopia, where she works directly with a single farmer; the rest of the café' s coffee is sourced locally. In addition to ethical sourcing, the Bushwick Grind works to improve food insecurity in their community with their Two Fish, Five Loaves community fridge. According to local estimates, one in every five Bushwick residents experienced food insecurity. Briana Calderon Navarro of Collective Focus, LLC speaks on the increase in community fridges in New York City, stating that "because the pandemic was such an abnormal time, for most of us, we were able to think creatively about what a solution could look like for our communities...dozens, if not hundreds of people all over New York City...decided to put refrigerators out on the sidewalks." The fridge operates on donations from organizations like Collective Focus, supermarkets, and Bushwick Grind. Donations like canned goods and feminine hygiene products are placed directly into the fridge and passersby take what they need daily. Visit the Bushwick Grind at 63 Whipple St, Brooklyn, NY, 11206

author: VNExplorer
title: CMIC se suma a la reconstrucción de Nuevo León tras fuertes lluvias por 'Alberto'
text: Comité de Reconstrucción de la tormenta ‘Alberto’ | Especial Para apoyar a resarcir los daños ocasionados por el fenómeno natural, la Cámara Mexicana de la Industria de la Construcción Nuevo León (CMIC NL) se sumó al Comité de Reconstrucción de la tormenta ‘Alberto’ que instauró el Gobierno del Estado. Al encuentro asistieron algunos alcaldes, representantes de los municipios del Área Metropolitana, funcionarios de la administración estatal y los miembros del Comité de Contingencias de CMIC NL. Este Comité de Reconstrucción quedó instituido formalmente por Hernán Villarreal, secretario de Movilidad estatal, en un evento realizado ayer en el Palacio de Gobierno. El funcionario estatal indicó que los carriles del par vial Constitución-Morones Prieto dañados por la tormenta deben quedar habilitados en dos meses. Villarreal cedió la palabra a Rodrigo Garza, secretario de CMIC, quien habló en representación de Roberto Macías, presidente del organismo. “Nosotros en la Cámara tenemos ya instalado un Comité de Contingencias, ya nos han tocado algunos fenómenos naturales y tenemos ya establecido un plan de trabajo”, explicó. Posteriormente el gobernador Samuel García Sepúlveda se sumó a la reunión vía remota y solicitó a los alcaldes contabilizar las afectaciones de sus municipios, como ya lo ha hecho Monterrey. Además informó que el lunes buscarán declarar estado de emergencia e iniciar los trámites para acceder a recursos federales y comenzar cuanto antes las labores de reconstrucción. Igual que Villarreal, el mandatario estatal destacó la aportación de la Cámara durante y posterior a la tormenta. “Agradezco también a la CMIC que se hayan movido tan pro activos”, señaló durante la reunión a la que asistió Juan Ignacio Barragán, titular de Agua y Drenaje de Monterrey. mrg
